Description:
Mechanical Designer – STETYou are responsible forLeading the execution of large-scale projects that drive global sourcing strategies to deliver the strategic business initiatives. This includes supplier management, E2E product launch management, lifecycle management among other critical sustaining engineering activities.

Responsible for creating E2E engineering release schedule to qualify products with new suppliers & release to production – this is the most critical aspect of the job responsibility & product development excellence is critical for success.

Accountable for resolving all technical challenges during the transfer process, which includes resolving product specification challenges, consulting with subject matter experts to guide suppliers, reverse engineering, driving design review workshops, develop test fixtures, etc.

Accountable for supplier quality performance in assigned projects to improve existing benchmarks and developing improvement plans to ensure Supply Chain target performance levels are achieved.

Responsible to ensure product requirements are fully defined to enhance quality through transfer projects, this would involve reverse engineering as needed.

Full responsibility to achieve critical KPIs for QUALITY and productivity targets that are tied to the annual business plans.

Partner with key business stakeholders to ensure that all business needs are met & improved through sourcing/concept projects.To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experienceCompleted engineering studies at University level; BE/BTech/ME/M-Tech in Mechanical

6-12 or more years of experience in Plastic Product design, Sheetmetal Design and Resolving issues in tools for Medical Devices / Home Appliances / Personal Health

Strong understanding of physics and hand calculation of the mechanical components for deciding strength, stiffness etc.

Proven design engineering and project management experience leading cross-functional teams

Experience supporting global projects 

Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills

Knowledge of manufacturing quality systems and working in a regulated industry

Working knowledge of Microsoft Project, Excel, Power Point, and Word required

Product Engineering, i.e. modules and parts in both metals and plastics; satisfying our esthetical, functional and manufacturability requirements (e.g. DFM / DFA). For AC/AD/PDLM and MLD projects.

Exposure to CAD (Creo and Equivalent), Windchill PDM / PLM for managing lifecycle of the components.

Tolerance design and 2D drawing creation (part specification)

Familiar with latest engineering design and methods, tools, and processes.Specific Knowledge/Skills:Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and PowerPoint

Familiar with the use of Product Data Management (PDM) systems

Hands on experience on Creo / Solid-works CAD Tools.

Disciplined team worker, ability to work independently with timely guidance.

Result oriented team player.

Excellent communication skills and Positive ‘can do’ attitude.

Quality mindset in design and documentation.In return, we offer youA meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth.
